title: The International Tournament of Law Enforcement Agencies

replies.msg:
The United Nations invited police forces from The United States, Japan, Hong Kong and China to participate in The First International Tournament of Law Enforcement Agencies.

There's only one mission for the tournament: catch the only rabbit hidden in a forest.

The Americans drew the first start. With high-tech gadgets including GPS, infrared imagery, heat seeking drones and AI video processors, they caught the rabbit in record time.

The judges put the rabbit back into the forest.

Next came the Japanese. With some old fashion detective skills, they combed through the forest for clues, rigorously tried to interpret the rabbit's behavior and deduced possible escape routes, they finally managed to catch the rabbit.

The judges put the rabbit back into the forest.

The Hong Kong Police went next. Three teams from different directions fired tear gas and rubber bullets into the forest. All animals were startled and darted towards the only direction left. A forth team, the Raptors, ambushed the animals, beating them with batons and shields. They successfully caught the rabbit whose legs were broken and skull cracked.

Failing to find another spare rabbit, the judges put the dead rabbit back into the forest.

Last came the Chinese. Without a hint of nervousness, they set up shop for a friendly mahjong game. Minutes before time expired, the cops finally entered the forrest and came back with a crippled fox.

The fox petitioned to the judges, 'I confess!! I am indeed a rabbit!! Please let me live!!'
